titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the D.C. Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run.
Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the D.C. Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 108-88.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 33.

action.text: Mr. Burgess moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 128.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure
committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management

bill.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the House on March 27, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Authorizes the 2003 District of Columbia Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run to be run through the Capitol grounds on June 6, 2003.
